narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: The instructor clearly knows the topic. Try to grasp what the important takeaways from the class are difficult.

The syllabus seemed like a holdover from the last time the course was taught. It's clear that Damian was discovering his own direction for the class as we went along. This was a reasonable approach for someone stepping into preexisting curriculum and teaching a class for the first time, but didn't help me understand the scope of the course.

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
comments: The expectations of the course work were too high. The topic is difficult to understand and extremely technical.
The expectations got clearer as the semester went along, but Damian was good about communicating as things were developing.

narratives.question_text: How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: Classes were always prepared and the information within the presentation was presented well.
He is very well pea pare with the presentation and document that he hand to student in class. He always have extra information and book for us to add more in the topic he taught.

The classes were well structured with good PowerPoint presentations. The material felt somewhat inaccessible, however, so it wasn't always easy to engage with the lectures. Clearly students who take the class want to know about acoustics, but few of them want to be acousticians. The material covered was all good and important, but lacked a useful context for the audience. The key to making this class really successful will be to find the framework that allows all the same topics to be discussed in a way that makes the utility of these skills readily apparent.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?
comments: I am still unsure what the primary goal of the class was. We covered many specifics as well as broad generalities on the topic. There are many complex situation and processes in the field of study.
There was far too much work. I found it difficult to keep up in the class.
There was a quantity of homework and reading that was a little difficult to keep up with early in the semester.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: The instructor always made it aware that he could be made available.

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: Again there are so many parts to the topic it was hard to say what helped in understanding the topic.

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: This class is more about building a theatre!!!

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Again the instructor is a leader within the field and is acutely aware of all the nuances to the subject matter.
He has a knowledge but it is hard for me to understand what he say because there are a lots of information and technical term that I do not understand. I wish he could explain it more simpler way.

Damian is clearly very talented an knowledgeable. I think this is his first time teaching a class like this, and it was a little rough. However, I think he is absolutely capable of refining his approach to make the class more engaging and informative.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: Either the course should cover a multitude of parts to the subject through individual assignments. Or the course should revolve around a single project and each assignment is a specific part of the project. For example: Assignment 1 - Do a ray tracing study of the space; Assignment 2 - calculate the total volume and each surface area of the space; Assignment 3 - calculate the reverberation times of the hall with and without the coupled volume; Assignment 4 - Compute the sound output of the HVAC system inside the hall; Assignment 5 - Compute the sound isolation necessary for 2 instances of noise, 1) Air Traffic and 2) Street noise through the walls. There are many ways to improve the course I think it is important to determine what should be the primary points to convey.

This class is more about TDMP class in term of learning more about the structure of the building and less for sound designer. I wish the topic will be more about theatre. Like practical stuff that we can use in production for example how could we adduct the scenery that affect the sound in theatre. I have learn some math in this class but I do not know how could i apply that number to my design.
